Ca1DU2iagwqrGrjyzmZcYg.text: Had an awesome experience at this restaurant in downtown Pittsburgh. The ambience is lively and casual, with out door seating overlooking market square. Although I haven't been to New Orleans before, I was advised on some of their classic dishes by our friendly and knowledgeable waiter who recommended we try the Voodoo crawfish that has a fun kick to it (yes, there is an art to eating these by twisting off the body from the heads and enjoying the tail portion of the fish which our waiter kindly demonstrated, served with an aioli based sauce), the grilled catfish (the mix of spices with sweet honey drizzle literally made me want to lick my plate clean), and finally the classic beignets (fried dough and powdered sugar served with your choice of chocolate or vanilla ice cream). By the end of my meal I was left checking my calendar to figure out when I get fly down to New Orleans and indulge in their food scene!

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5jaA2tnmB4ENQXyWc6eptw.text: So delicious! Better than the reviews! I ordered the oysters to start and then had the Louisiana pasta without the extra crawfish. Crawfish certainly would complement this pasta and definitely would blend well with the sauce, but it's a hearty pasta to begin with. I had enough to reheat as leftovers the next day and it reheat well. The sausage was delicious and the chicken was even better the second day. They didn't have live music the night I went, but I'd like to come back when they do. They have nice outdoor seating and indoor seating near the windows. It's so tasty!

PTarOVdA9iySLn8Zlz5dHg.text: Yes. Location! Location! Location! The food at NOLA was a crowd pleaser today but the view was spectacular!  We sat on the same side of the table with our chairs towards the square. People watching in the city of Pittsburgh is fun and NOLA is an excellent place to do it!  Ate too much but it was worth every calorie.   We had the crispy alligator and fried green tomatoes. Both were delish. The ranch made in house served with the tomatoes was really interesting and very different. Next I had the shrimp and grits. Dang. Is it possible to have too many shrimp? Or was it just that I ate too much for a lunch? Because this large portion was f*ing amazing. The best shrimp and grits I've had in the Burgh. Finally, the service. I could have started with the service. Our waiter was charming and attentive. His perfectly trimmed beard and hair was everything. So much so that I had to compliment him   Good day at NOLA!

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outdoor seating on a beautiful September day!
Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VSz7Y0yt756h8DgtwReViQ.text: Perfect location in market square. Sat outside & enjoyed the ambiance & good service (Thanks to my waiter Mike)! House Pinot gregio was nice & loved the seafood jambalaya. It's a must try! Can't wait to go back next time & try the fried green tomatoes. Heard several great things about them as well!

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood jambalaya &amp; house Pinot gregio

Pvp1H_WkNLLYhXO_jIy_PA.text: A sultry July evening in downtown Pittsburgh and steps from the hotel we stopped into Nolas. We opted for an outdoor table, to absorb the ambience of the square. Choices abounded-chain sub, pizza , or "taco" but we decided upon a taste of New Orleans. Inside was air conditioned tin ceilinged comfort, but the patio was beckoning. Nice drink beer and wine lists with happy hour specials til 7. Appetizers too are on special. Nice variety on the main menu and server Ian was helpful and attentive. Overall prices are reasonable, $18/dozen large raw oysters is a deal these days! If you're downtown in Pittsburgh, Nolas is worth a try!

a39qxyDlmg9wbYWNapwKRg.text: Located right in the middle of Market Square in downtown Pittsburgh, NOLA brings you a nearly authentic Creole/New Orleans style vibe and cuisine. My sister and I had dinner next-door and were lured by the amazing band at NOLA. It was a Jamaican sounding band and the place was packed. There were even people outside listening in because the windows were open. We were able to snag a few seats at the end of the bar to put our stuff down but we danced right away. I finally tried the Ketel One Botanical line mixed with basil and lemon. It was refreshing and I was happy I tried something different, but ultimately I changed a straight away to Ketel and soda water with a lemon, as did my sister. It took a while to put our drink order in because it was so busy, but other than that the service was pretty great. When in Rome, I had to finally try frog legs. Turns out I don't like them very much, I also don't like fried food so I guess it wasn't a great decision, but at least I can say I tried! I also tried oysters but they were very salty for my taste. I also didn't like that they served them with Ritz crackers in the plastic wrap, it cheapened it for me. I'm also from New England so have high oysters & seafood standards. Overall, this place has a very fun vibe and was totally packed on a Saturday. I would return here for the music and the drinks! I would skip the food.

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribbit.
Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Frog legs.

mB6DVbEpEX_0GSpjeZ5wvQ.text: I have enjoyed lunch here many times on a Friday. As usual the server was was friendly and fast. This time I had a half sandwich and half soup, Nola club and cauliflower soup, with voodoo fries and mint mocktail which was a great compliment to the entree. This meal fueled us for the holiday shopping ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mint mocktail
Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half sandwich and soup - Nola club and cauliflower soup

lwrsq5iPt0MDEXK43Fgzhg.text: I can't believe that I have never written a review for this restaurant.  How rude!  And now one of my favorite lunch spots is being sold to another local chain. I just hope that the new owners don't screw everything up....  I've seen that happen where a new owners takes over an existing restaurant and decides to make too many tweaks.  Bleh!  ("Oh, let's just add turmeric to all of the existing recipes and that will be our "signature" touch")  You get my point.  I just feel bad that they have been so negatively impacted by several fires within the business and I'm sure that has screwed around with their business.  However, if you want some decent New Orlens vittles, Nola on the Square will treat you right.  I have had almost their ENTIRE lunch menu.  (I know, that's ridiculous)  You can't go wrong with any of SOUP, SALAD, & SANDWICH DUOS.  Seriously!  Your tummy will be as tight as a drum after eating one of their po boy sandwiches. (Shrimp, Catfish, Alligator or Roast Beef, you can't wrong, especially served with the Voodoo fries.)!   The lunch entrees are bomb diggity too. Shrimp and Grits, Grilled Catfish and my favorite, Poulet Frites et Salade!   Oh my!(Do you know how hard it is to get a chicken crispy on the outside and moist on the inside?  As someone who cooks, it's not the easiest hat trick to pull off.)  The appetizers (Crispy Fried Alligator, Fried Green Tomatoes) and soups (Red Beans & Rice, Gumbo Ya-Ya and French Onion) are also, right tasty!   I'm trying to stay in town one night for their Grilled Chicken & Dumplings, because I've got a feeling that that dish is going to be off the chain. My sister, Luch, was stationed in New Orleans and they have some AMAZING restaurants.  However, if you can't make it there, go check out Nola on the Square and I think that you will be pleasantly surprised.

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Yeah man!

sGMRVGeb7xnId8Fwl9tyPQ.text: I think NOLA is great. There's definitely a ton of options in Market Square but this is one of the more unique ones. You definitely get the New Orleans feel with this place, and the space itself is much bigger than you'd think from the outside. They had a band previously when I was there. Our server was excellent, very friendly and attentive. They have a pretty big drink menu, I had the "Cajun Martini" which was very good. The menu has a lot of intersting options, I contemplated getting the alligator bites. I ended up going with the Cajun Chicken Sandwich which was great, could've been a little spicier. Overall, worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cajun Chicken Sandwich

Az_B0BGU_WImDDrYATbifQ.text: I've been here twice and the service and food have been great. Also if you're thinking about the gator, just order it. The texture is somewhere between chicken and fish, and the taste is...well mostly the spicy aioli (which was great, so no one minded).

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried alligator bites

Oez-Akp0K4204Ik44eZtMw.text: Meh. Inadequate wait staff. Mediocre food / but with good flavors for sure. But no need for the high prices.

sUUmb0S2oAmB0f-MvZIX2Q.text: Lunch today. Very impressed. Fun atmosphere. Great service and food. Shrimp appetizer was outstanding. Gumbo solid and enjoyed the shrimp po boy. Not sure about the dinner menu but lunch prices very reasonable.

6CC2pKwlXNc1YLkAi84XJA.text: Good service, good food & awesome atmosphere! Great addition to Market Square. The jambalaya was yummy!

RLCHynNhQN94ZJd2C_lbyw.text: It is nice to have a somewhat decent, somewhat cajun place north of the Mason Dixon line.  While the food is pretty darn good (not great), I have to give the place high marks for bringing this style of cooking up north.  Keeping with the style, they have several Abita beers on tap, which are hard enough to find in bottles.  The gumbo is really good, but the portion is small and relatively expensive.  The blackened seasoning has been salty, but when I ask for less salt they do comply.  The waitstaff and bar tenders are very friendly.  Stay away from the banana foster bread pudding dessert, it is so unbelievably good and decadent I'm sure you're selling your soul to the devil.

9g1DP-60typcAI1dcKzmfw.text: Great downtown restaurant. The ambiance is intimate and cool, and their menu is definitely different and refreshing from typical Pittsburgh dining that can get stale. Nice wine list, creative menu. However, not much for vegetarians--maybe 3-4 salads/entrees/appetizers that I could actually have. But the vegetarian dishes available all sounded delicious, so I didn't mind at all.

sgihRt2XHDtVdHd8u73ydA.text: I was somewhat disappointed.  The food was just ok.  We had to ask for bread.  The salad was too 'tart' - a lot of oil.  The pasta that I had was just ok -- nothing to write home about.  The drinks were good.  I was disappointed in the peach cobbler.  The renovations are nice though.  We could see the kitchen from our table and that was nice even though my husband wanted the chef to start yelling.  I'm not sure I would go out of my way to go back.

an6YSoeVIHaokerkKFS69A.text: Great food but overpriced.  Food is good and lunch prices are OK.  Oyster po-boy and jambalaya were very good, although the po-boy has way too much bread.

IS0q9V_jy84nzSDArd1b9Q.text: We tried their jambalaya and po-boy shrimp. The jambalaya was modelately spicy but kept good flavor. Shrimp po-boy was de-licious!!!!! They have a special cole slaw that was tangy and went well with the meals we got.

oo3HeRqNVEC4bE4MWHSldA.text: Came on a friend's recommendation- definitely a good one.  Came for lunch on a weekday so it wasn't busy and our server was very friendly/knowledgeable.  I ordered the Shrimp and Grits and had to order a side of the Voo Doo french fries once I saw an order pass by me.  This was my first time getting shrimp and grits and I was very satisfied- the grits were nice and creamy, and the shrimp were huge and plump (although I will say that there weren't TOO many of them, just enough to have a bit with each scoop of grits).  The fries were also great, I think they're slightly breaded and then have some cajun seasoning on them- definitely order a side of them if you don't get some with your order.  The price was about right, a little high if anything.  Overall, I would definitely recommend this place.

QU4_EKbZSTmsjQkzXVAhmQ.text: Stopped in on a Friday night after work for happy hour and dinner. The place was packed but we had reservations for a party of 10. The service we received was phenomenal even though the restaurant filled. The food was the best Cajun food I have had outside of New Orleans. Our entire group feels that this place is The best new restaurant in Pittsburgh. Bravo to owners and chef . Highly recommend it. If I could give this experience 10 stars I would.

LYfe9YqgpQ4dWcZqMFghcQ.text: I really enjoyed this place.  We were seated quickly, and the service was awesome.  They have a fine wine list, and will let you sample different wines so you can choose one you like.  Their usual jazz band was playing as well, and while it did make the atmosphere a bit more noisy, the music was very good.  The food was pretty good-- I had the fish special and my companion and I shared the fried alligator appetizer (which I recommend).  I also recommend the St. Charles cocktail (which is basically a dressed-up gin and tonic).  All in all, very pleasant.  Will definitely be back.

65_lw01xY_bpjRiNS3v3ug.text: Been here a few times. Good representation of New Orleans food, but wish the menu was a bit broader.

cG2Ar05YYRNu1LWR0WfZHA.text: Have been there twice on weekend afternoons.  Food gets an A+ for wonderful jambalaya and bisque, salads, and sandwiches.  Service, however... the first time we went there I attribute it to "working out the kinks" but the second time we went and waited about 20 minutes for our waiter, and he was downright RUDE.  Still, the food is so good I'm willing to give it another try.

0-YIU3M0tS7XxQ2W66wi6g.text: I love NOLA! From the drinks to the food to the ambiance. I went on August 17th and had a very enjoyable experience. Out waitress was very helpful and knowledge about the drinks they had including the different beers (I love trying new and different beers so this was very nice to have someone who knows).  My friends ordered the oysters and the crab special. While they seemed like small plates for the price, they appeared as if they were well enjoyed. We were given one of the pizzas courtesy of the chef and I must say that it was one of the best crusts I have had since moving to Pittsburgh. I would order the crawfish and andouille sausage any time.  For dinner, everyone at the table got the Steak et Frites. AMAZING! You can tell alot of care went into the food as the fries are well seasoned, the salad is perfectly dressed and the steak was tender and delicious.  The crowd tended to be older but it was still a very nice atmosphere and I had a great experience.

QAmQ1JSZBnbWIt6iHeTQ0w.text: Me and my date stopped in last night and loved this place! The bartender was very professional and extremely friendly, he knew the menu and the drinks very well. The atmosphere and music was great. We had the BBQ shrimp, it was fabulous! I would definitely go back!

_neP8W78IlvvLUcJMAzv9w.text: We recently for a client meeting there and had a reservation for 14 people. Were seated timely in their upper level room. The server was knowledgeable and knew the menu by heart. I ordered the Steak Frites et Salade and was not too happy with it. The fries were on the mark and were freshly made and the salad was average, but i was hugely disappointed with the Hanger Steak (Medium) what was chewy and cold as if it was lying for a while until they prepared everyone's order and ready to serve. The ambiance was average and the carpets could use a makeover too.

OsDyD7JI1_X4e7UWvik7bg.text: The service was amazing, the food was the best, and the mixed drinks were so yummy!   I have tried this place for the first time yesterday and plan on making it a regular of mine.  The waiter was so very nice and very helpful on what to choose based on our taste buds.  He knew alot about how the food was made and the history of the resturaunt.  I cant wait to go again and would really reccomend everyone try it.....you 2 will become a reguar!

dQKZI_Kgv-T4mdhytO9rdw.text: I love NOLA. If it were less expensive I would eat here all the time. Alas, it is on Market Square so the menu prices are high. I've eaten dinner here twice and also came once for brunch. The first time I was here was for a pre-theater dinner. We were seated in the dining room next to the windows into the kitchen so I could watch all the food being prepared. I've read reviews claiming that the jambalaya must be pre-made and frozen. It isn't. I watched a chef make it to order and put it in the brick oven. The second time we were seated in the dining area in the front room near the bar, and the third time I ate at the bar. Thus far I've had grit cakes, shrimp and grits, fried green tomatoes, seafood soup, and beignets. As far as I can tell this is the only place in Pittsburgh that serves beignets. They aren't quite as good as the ones in New Orleans, but they are a pretty good approximation. The food is well prepared and (as the server told us on my first trip there) adapted spice-wise to Pittsburgh, meaning that the Cajun/Creole flavors have been toned down a bit. They will give you hot sauce upon request to spice the food up. As far as drinks go, they have a pretty nice wine list. I had a couple of cocktails when I was there for brunch and I wasn't blown away by them. They seemed a little weak. Also, the service here is hit or miss. They sometimes seem a little disorganized in terms of who is handling which tables. I can live with that though since the food is so good and the atmosphere at the bar is so much fun.

zZ7qRICGSYEf568v9pt6PQ.text: being from both new orleans and cajun country, i go into restaurants outside of louisiana who offer louisiana food with very low expectations.  that being said, my rating for nola is a combination of the atmosphere, service, food and especially abita on tap (which i totally appreciate).    i had the red beans and rice which wasn't bad - it needed more flavor and heat but is made correctly with the bean paste.  i also had the abita battered shrimp which comes with a pepper sauce - not bad but it's better for the heat to be part of the batter rather than the cooked shrimp sprinkled with chili powder.  also, the cole slaw was not good.  finally, we had the griddle grits which was ok.  the flavor was strange at first but it grows on you.  the presentation of all the food was nice, but $11 for a few shrimp and $17 for grits is overpriced.  the service was attentive and good.  the kind of music played was spot on.  finally, one recommendation would be to put hot sauce on the tables, which is standard in louisiana and needed for what was served.

Nz-t-0VtHUU8N6XOLAo2Nw.text: I was so disappointed in this place!  It started at the door!  There was a band playing with music 100% too loud!  the speaker was aimed right back into the restaurant making talking to anyone almost impossible.  When the host made it up to the host stand after us waiting at least 4 minutes I asked for a table outside.  Her response was and I quote "Did you see any out there?"  WHAT?!?  I calmly responded with "I don't know, I didn't look."  She went and checked and sadly there were no tables.  We were placed in a two top on the back of the place by the kitchen door.  Our waiter explained one of the specials as "the crabs sit on berries, they look like you can't eat them, but you can."  Now is that something that would like to order?  Our waiter took our drink order and left, then a busboy came up and faced his back to us while holding a plastic sauce container of water and turned his head and asked "would you like some water?"  it was like it was a drug deal and he was trying to be shady about it.  It was very weird.  After asking "what" three times because the music was so loud I couldn't hear him and the fact that he wasn't facing me, I just gave up and said yes.  He quickly came back with two wine glasses of water on a tray.  While handing placing the one glass down on the table the other tipped and fellow right in the lap of my dining partner.  Now I have been a server as he was at once also, and we understand that these mistakes happen.  However it was very odd that the busboy gave the wet guest a napkin then went right away to cleaning up the carpet.  That was the tipping point and the proof needed that the guest does not matter.  We decided that it was better that we just leave and go somewhere that will respect us and treat us as a guest should be treated.

WUKNvsEhTkLWLBRSyIxdQQ.text: As good as it gets. EXPENSIVE. yes, great service, atmosphere, and food. It all really ties into the creole, new orleans feel, and its something different for pittsburgh. I read all of there reviews, about the alligator, the grits...etc. So my friend and I ordered the famous alligator, and being a culinary student, I was ambitious to try it. AWESOME, please try it. Our next courses were the Roasted Quail, and the Seafood jambalaya. 25$ a pop, now this may be due to the fact that the waitress asked if we were sharing, but it's still expensive. However no matter the price it was amazing, the jambalaya was smokey, and all about the seafood. Now my favorite was the Quail, just so juicy with the right spices, and the red wine reduction sauce, just my mouth is watering as we speak...and I just left. Now there was no dessert menu, not even listed on the website, and I was dying for a sweet finish, and all I wanted was a banana's foster. So the waitress Abigail instructed us that, they make their desserts day of, and they had a banana's foster bread pudding with a salted caramel ice cream. BOMB DIGGGITTTYY! I'm totally making this myself. A transformation  of the original and it was just the right finish. They also have live entertainment, I'd suggest to make a reservation via open table or what not, but I over heard the hostess talking to another guest that they do get packed when there is live entertainment. Now you would think that it would get so loud in there. No I wasn't screaming out the top of my lungs to my friend, it was so casual, so jazzy, and so a perfect night. BTW hot valet boys and complimentary at that; after 5 on the weekends I believe. Expect an awesome atmosphere, great food plus service. Just expect to spend your pretty pennies on it. All thumbs up!

vfOODg5gwC_HZWr0HYGtHQ.text: Its nice to see a Louisiana style place open in Pittsburgn and the location is great.. However, after just being to New Orleans and coming here I can say its not really comparable to a nice restaurant down there. Food is pretty overpriced and just doesn't taste quite right. Service was pretty good, and its a big restaurant with free valet parking. Its decorated tastefully too.

OABqj3QTvJ6YJvu0gGSo1A.text: We came here for happy hour and it was great. Service was quick and and I like the location! No veggie items but that is to be expected at a cajun place.

N2eiRfUYeze53zuq-l8EMg.text: NOLA is our go-to lunch spot at work. It's pretty great. I have mostly had sandwiches there, so I can't comment on their entrees on the menu. The have solid and interesting food, at a good price. Their fries are can't-help-yourself good. Really. They have one of the best veg sandwiches (Pan Bagnat) I thinkI've ever had. They offer combos of soup+salad or soup+sandwich or salad+sandwich, which is my favorite thing to get. The French onion soup is pretty amazing, salty, cheesy, and with thick chunks of bread under a thick layer of gruyere. Basically the food is great, and I haven't heard anything negative from anyone I've gone there with, with the exception of an off day in the kitchen, that happened maybe once. For a new restaurant, I think they got their chit together pretty quickly, and made some minor changes to the menu after a few weeks, which I think improved the place. I can't speak to their authentic-ness, but they are pretty damn good.   The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is always nice and inviting, with a nice little outdoor area for those beautiful days in the square. They do, however, have one of the worst entrance/lobby/hostess stations in the world. You are basically standing in the middle of the main thoroughfare through the restaurant while waiting to talk to the hostess. And if you happen to have to wait for a table, then you are awkwardly trying to find a place to put yourself with out being in the way. There is basically no where to stand without bothering someone, and that bothers me. It's nice that they have the most amount of seating possible in there, but it would be even nicer if that awkwardness was done away with the removal of one or two tables.

isnrogSyUI48bDS2qj9DGA.text: Really liked this place.  The cuisine was good.  Haven't tried the jumbalaya yet, but will definitely go back when I get a chance.

MukBt4Le-03xYvr8q4LAIg.text: Excellent shrimp appetizer! Ok flatbread. I would return. Music was too loud and the service was awful. I'd give them another chance!

qSDb-AEzrmVS2uqNTdnRBw.text: Great vibe.  Great service. (Maybe a little too chatty).  Great music.   Food was only good not great.  Appreciated the attention to detail but my Jambalaya was only OK.

qOlqQTXLY-fGIQKZWZUUpw.text: I stopped at Nola for dinner and drinks while on biz in Pittsburgh...and YEZZIR this is a good spot!  If you go, you gotta try the Scallops Mac Daddy...good stuff!  Had some live music poppin and drinks were flowing.  Right in Market Sq so overall nice atmosphere.

3aCiRRPokD1CNCw89rbfaw.text: We went to NOLA on a Friday night when we had tickets to a show in the cultural district. I had the crispy alligator bites to start, and the jambalaya for my meal. The aioli on the alligator was excellent - I was eating the crunchy fried bits that came off of the meat just to scoop up the sauce. The jambalaya had an excellent taste. As someone who has been to New Orleans, I can safely say that it tasted _nothing_ like actual New Orleans jambalaya, so if you are looking for authentic creole, you will be disappointed.  The jambalaya was very tomatoey, and not nearly as spicey as I expected. And, there were just 2 pieces each of shrimp and scallop on the top, and none mixed in with the rice. However, although I would not characterize it as authentic, it was still delicious. The blackened chicken and spicy sausage that was mixed in with the rice was really good. I would eat here again, and if I did, I would probably get the jambalaya again (again, the food tasted very good, as long as you don't expect authentic). On a side note, I mentioned to the server that we couldn't linger too long, because we had theatre tickets, and he told us that if we could show him the tickets, we could get a 15% discount. So that was a nice bonus, and if you come before a show, be sure to bring your tickets with you.

VG15-jn56hIAachXY5RduA.text: We've dined here a few times now. I've only been disappointed once as they ran out of oysters. I'm looking forward to lunch as they have a few New Orleans classics which are not on the dinner menu (that is a mistake in my opinion).

JmAAchBegFhjXs94g5uBIA.text: On a Thursday evening, without a reservation we tried to get a table here.  The hostess was very welcoming so we waited and scored an awesome table outdoors!!!  We enjoyed the glorious evening - the music was at a conversational level.  The server (and I'm mortified I didn't catch her name but she is expecting) was warm and engaging.  She had us trying alligator (+++) and was spot on with her individual recommendations to us.

WRdXm6W6WxR50iQJNJGJTQ.text: Eager if not expert service (lots of "who gets what dish" when the food came). Mediocre but decent French onion soup (served only wam, rather than hot). Catfish was nicely cooked, but swimming in butter. I didn't so much mind that, being a big fan of butter....however that is, of course, a lazy way to make something taste good.

EMnPMxb73gFaRAjBpgkTBA.text: I wanted to like this place, I really really REALLY did. After moving from New Orleans we were begging for a place that had food from home. This, however, is nothing like it. Even the atmosphere was oddly wrong? Like they read a book on how one thinks New Orleans restaurants are decorated but not how they actually are. Although, the large painting of the second line is great. We did some research and the artists aren't even from Nola, they commissioned someone local. We were then shocked to discover that NONE OF THE CHEFS HAVE COOKED IN NEW ORLEANS!! And boy, it is evident in the food. Now if you are unfamiliar with creole/cajun style cooking I would guess that you would enjoy this place. If, however, you are used to real dining from New Orleans, this will do nothing but disappoint. Service was slow (hey! they got one thing right! haha), cocktails were subpar, and the food lacked the flavor depth that we are used to. I will say one thing, the boudin was pretty darn good! And while this is just being picky, if you are going to have a restaurant themed such as this, your servers should know how to properly pronounce the food they are serving-there's no 'L' sound in andouille (again, picky but in my opinion, True.) Sadly, we still have not found a place that comes even close to home :(

4FAghKDT38yD-n9az7givQ.text: I've been to Nola on the Square a total of three times now, and (thankfully) every trip was better than the last.  My first trip there was a bit rocky.  Granted, I was there on a Saturday night with a group of about 10.  Plus the restaurant had only been open for a few weeks at that point, so they were probably still working the kinks out at that point.  The packed restaurant definitely took a toll on our service, which was verrrry slow.  And by the time our party arrived, our waiter informed us that they were completely out of pasta, which resulted in almost half the table having to re-examine the menu for another option, including myself.  I understand that this happens, but it still looked pretty bad to be out of pasta by 8pm on a Saturday night in a relatively new restaurant.  I ended up ordering the special dish of the night, which was steak with some form of potatoes and spinach.  All very good, but nothing to write home about.  My second visit found myself and my parents there late on a Sunday afternoon.  We walked in to find the restaurant relatively empty of both patrons.....and staff.  There were three hostesses working, and after receiving a poorly-disguised eye roll from one after I told her we didn't have reservations, they all informed us that the ENTIRE wait staff was currently in a meeting, so no one was available yet to take our order.  We then proceeded to wait 20 minutes for the wait staff meeting to adjourn before we could even order a glass of water.  But I put my annoyance at that situation on the hostessses, not the waiters.  It wasn't the waiters fault they were ALL pulled into a meeting simultaneously, and apparently it wasn't in the hostess' job description to ask paying patrons if they wanted something to drink while we waited.  But ANYWAY.  Once our waitress arrived (she was quite lovely), she promptly brought our drinks and took our order.  Our food arrived in a timely manner and was very good.  I had the smoked pork chop which was massive and cooked and seasoned very well.  So despite the horribly rocky start, our meal ended quite nicely.  So FINALLY, upon my third visit, I had a completely positive Nola experience.  My group was promptly seated and our server was very informative and attentive the entire time.  I ordered the Scallps Mac Daddy which was soooooo yummy.  It's hard to go wrong with any combination of mac and cheese plus seafood, so this dish was absolutely delicious.  I can't wait to go back for my fourth visit and get it again!  So, after working some glitches out of its system, Nola finally seems to be working like the well-oiled machine it was always meant to be!

emipsgT8SNPS42_qu3ZhbQ.text: I took my fiance to NOLA on the square for her birthday dinner this evening. We're both from the south, and half of my family hails from/resides in New Orleans. We had a 7PM reservation made weeks ago, and were seated immediately upon arrival. We selected the fried alligator and red beans and rice as our starters. The alligator was PHENOMENAL(best I've ever had) and the red beans and rice was spot on! I had the shrimp and grits, while my fiance chose the shrimp and scallops mac daddy. Both were excellent. We settled on the apple/caramel bread pudding for dessert. It was great, as well as the homemade vanilla ice cream that accompanied it. My fiance had the sangria, and enjoyed it. It was a little too rosy for my liking, but it satisfied her palate. Our waiter, Sean, was sufficiently attentive, and the manager, Mark, made his rounds to ensure that each guest had a pleasurable experience. I love the open kitchen setup, which affords you the opportunity to witness the painstaking approach and dedication that is shown to each plate. We often joke about how Yinzers (generally speaking) don't know good food when they taste it, and often make horrible reviews on good, if not great, restaurants on here. We look forward to coming back to try brunch and po-boys at lunch! Also worth noting, parking is a premium around the square... That being said, if you make one pass with no spots available, there are a couple of parking garages that are a short walking distance from NOLA.

4UuU9hpb2eB7jNZxChFnEA.text: I recently visited Nola with two friends for dinner and had a wonderful experience!  We really wanted to find somewhere fun that still had  great food and Nola certainly fit the bill.  We had a wonderful waiter who did an excellent job seeing that we had just what we wanted.  We couldn't decide what to order and so we told our waiter we wanted three separate entrees and that we wanted to share.  He suggested that he bring out the appetizer first and then the entrees in succession one after another.  We ordered the Crispy Fried Alligator as an appetizer and it was delicious and perfectly seasoned.  The first entree we received was the Shrimp and Grits and it was really delicious.  Two of the people in my group (myself included) have lived in the southern low country and are shrimp and grits snobs and this definitely lived up to expectations!  The second entree was definitely the favorite of the bunch.  We ordered the catfish and it was absolutely delicious.  Our final entree was the jumbalaya and it was highly recommended by our waiter.  It was heated in the wood stove so there was a charred flavor to the stew that I really enjoyed but two other members of our group found off-putting.  The waiter encouraged us to eat dessert but we were simply too full!  Next time, we will definitely give it a try!  We will definitely visit Nola again!  It was an all around wonderful experience!

p2kAkNgn2qszutYuZnz2vA.text: GOOD FOOD AND DRINKS WITH FRIENDS  I came here on a week night, even on the week night it was a little loud.  This wasn't an issue for my friends and I.  We had several drinks (good Hurricanes) and some small bites of food.  The French Onion soup was very good, a little too salty but very flavorful overall.  The baked oysters were very good overall.    Our waiter (Shane) was very good and helped us learn more about Pittsburgh and the surrounding area.  It's not the best place for an intimate dinner, however a great place for drinks and food with a group of friends.

HyA0W_QqrEOqX8-H9mKjLQ.text: I eat there over a year ago and it was very disappointing and since have had 2 friends eat there and felt the same. I guess my evening was not a fluke.

j2_-MRQV4KdNV6AFJvMtiw.text: Awesome place! Abagail made great recommendations. Ordered the Eggs Bene app, when she saw the egg wasnt runny enough she took it back without any hesitation and it came out perfect. The star of the show was my Pork Osso Buco, it was the best put together dish I have ever had. The pork was cooked perfectly to fall off the bone. The blacked eyed peas, roasted brussels sprouts and spinach blew me away. The depth in it was mind blowing, citrus and garlic tones on it. It worked. I will be back every time I'm in Puttsburgh. Abagails service was second to none. Thanks.

HkWkTyvCeHnacp-_XThFJQ.text: We had a reservation and did not have to wait at all. There was live jazz but I was glad to not be seated near the bar- it would have been way too loud for any conversation. We started with a rum/milk/chocolate cocktail which was good but strong. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. We kicked off our meal with a starter of fried shrimp and it was just fantastic. The portion size was good and the hot pepper jelly was a great complement  to the flavors. We followed it up with grilled catfish. It was cooked perfectly. I am not a big fan of mashed potatoes and opted to add some hot sauce to the dish. We were offered a selection of 7-8 hot sauces. Loved it! The dessert selection didn't tempt us much and there weren't too many choices for vegetarians. But it's a nice place and we might go back to try the other fish choices.

b2S5MWgoOsKfXrNp6itwRQ.text: Very much enjoyed the atmosphere, both staff and patrons made my evening a great time. The food was excellent, drinks affordable, and the band gave me a reason to dance. Fun!

bWaJWC2gJqFsRiU_4j-i1w.text: Terrible terrible food. Oversalted, overcooked, the fried alligator had more breading than alligator, the beignets were flat and not crispy at all. Skip this one.

_bLVZeq-JYRHBgIRZwh4fQ.text: Excellent gumbo. Jumbalaya was ok.  Good selection of beer.  They had live music and so it was really loud. Had no shout to talk. The bad was good but just not time to chat.

RQLdGxYtNI9_lSvbswOzPQ.text: Delicious flavorful and interesting menu options. Well-stocked bar and yummy drinks. Fun and relaxing atmosphere. Friendly waitress.

Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wild mushroom bread pudding

ZMSb591dMw9A8fZv4j68ww.text: NOLA was wonderful.  I wish we had gotten there sooner to hear more music as the music ends at 11.  Service was attentive and friendly. Great salads and Flatbread.  If I lived in PGH I'd visit this place again for sure. The BBQ shrimp was just as good as you get in New Orleans.

q0g9rKs3FfFg3OvfXYTHaA.text: Food was good not great but the service was awful. I don't even know our servers name because we hardly saw her. Large party for a bday and two meals came 10 mins after everyone else's. No apology. No manager came by. We had to ask for a lot of stuff. 4 people in our party work in a restaurant and usually hook up the servers but we all agreed it was unacceptable our service. Thank goodness my meal was good. Oh and they brought out the bday cake when half of the party was gone and dishes still on the table. It wasn't completely terrible service but a large party of 15 should have more than 1 server on it. Management really needs to train staff on proper steps of service.

ISS2I8AuAaZ4EniltGvTeg.text: I went to nola last night for happy hour. Cheap apps (under $5), $1 gumbo a d $1 red beans and rice a drink specials. All were very good and different. Most was not as spicy as I would have assumed! Food was quick and good. Tried the alligator bites and they were very unique and tasty ! Worth a try even though they were not on happy hour.  Food was good but services was not up to bar. I was dining with friends and we were ordering a variety of small plates. We were from out if the area so we aaked what the happy hour specials were. He got annoyed and only gave us some of the details and we had to inquiry about more. He got annoyed when we would order something.  He barely checked in and got annoyed if we had any comment. Another bartender talked to us and she was much nicer !  If the food hadn't been as good and we hadn't driven 2 hours to try it, I would have left because of that guy.

eAnbI4_BZjXOPCORbbS1Ig.text: There was a piece of paper in my $30 duck dish. They took the plate away, didn't bring anythig else and still charged me full price for it. Need I say more?

q525hPH0KnxW4JzFuRg8dA.text: We were here for our friend's birthday.  We were sat at a table in the back room which was very cute.  The food was very good.  As for the service it wasn't very good.  I'm not sure if it was because we were slightly off to the back, but we had to ask for refills multiple times and had to wait pretty long for our condiments.  The server maybe have just had an off day.    The food and drinks were great, but the service was best described as, "meh", haha.  It won't deter me from going back, every server has an off day.

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Not the prettiest plate, but it was fantastic steak!

iVfEb-cLVj6BEsyc-WOGiQ.text: Not NEW ORLEANS But....there food was good and service was amazing. The alligator was pretty decent and the sauce that came with it was absolutely amazing. (It was a great appetizer). I ordered the jambalaya which had a very very heavy tomato base and two other people with me thought it was spicy(I love spicy, but didn't feel it was). The size of the portion was perfect but I was not expecting more sauce than rice.

sEnWV8-VpxvjMjhAoU4BzA.text: Today's visit for lunch was just ok.  Not as good as previous visits for lunch and dinner. I attended a lunch outing with my team.   Our server Kelli, was great, she was patient and attentive.  I ordered the mushroom panini and voodoo fries.  I also ordered the gumbo appetizer as a starter.   The gumbo arrived a short time later, and it was ok, but the base tasted just a little bit burnt.  It was good, but had a bitter aftertaste.  The panini sandwich was a bit of a disappointment.  The multi-grain bread would have been better had it been toasted correctly.  The bread had been buttered and not left on the grill long enough to toast properly, which left the bread greasy and soggy.   Also the portabello mushroom was much smaller than the bread slices, so there was LOTS of bread and very little mushroom.   I'll definitely return to NOLA, but would definitely order a different item.

KBYQMiX5FGglcB6MEUjzPw.text: The food was really good but I couldn't give this place 5 stars because of the 2 bartenders.. Especially the blonde girl bartender..terrible attitude , rude and slow I ordered a Stella draft which tasted flat and water down..when I told her the beer was no good she took it to the manager who took a sip and they both looked at me like I was crazy..never came back n apologized just asked what other beer I would like..every time I finished a beer they would take the bottle n not ask if I would like another one or I would have to wave my hand to get another beer because they all stood at the end of the bar talking instead of taking care of the 3 ppl sitting at the bar..shout out to the chef and the server who brought my meal to me at the bar they both did a great job

RPEb8wBWDb9jeVpjczQIPw.text: Maybe it's because I had high expectations based on reviews I had read, but I was a little disappointed in the food.   We had the seafood jambalaya which wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. It had a very... interesting flavor (for lack of a better word). I'm not an expert at jambalaya but it didn't taste like what I remember. It had a bit of a sour taste to it which I decided I didn't like because it reminded me of food that was spoiling.   We also had the Gumbo Ya-ya, and Creole Pulled Pork Po Boy. The gumbo was pretty good. As for the Creole Pulled Pork Po Boy, the pork  was pretty bland but it tasted good when eaten with the gumbo. It was served on fresh bread.   The restaurant itself was pretty loud. Our waitress was really friendly and nice and the bathrooms were clean which is always a  bonus. Overall, I only gave NOLA a 3 star because I really did NOT like the way the jambalaya tasted. I had higher expectations for the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Seafood Jambalaya

HrVk9MK6Z5gXCkghSpJAxQ.text: Food was 4 star and $$, however due to lack of good hosting and service they get overall 3 stars ! I will be coming back to try their sandwich menu next time! Try jambalaya entree it's really good !

photos.caption: Photo of NOLA - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. NOLA Painting

CI8b3QhzpMhlYkk-QpTdKw.text: Talk about world problems. It's tough to write a negative review for a restaurant experience during which you actually enjoyed your meal. HOWEVER, after three times trying NOLA it's time for an official 2-star review.  In my past experience here, the service has been very slow.  Fine, really - as long as you have the time to spare.  Yesterday's visit was no exception.    Our party of 6 arrived to a mostly-empty restaurant between 12:30 and 12:45 for NOLA's brunch.  Three members of our group ordered the special of the day: Banana Bread French Toast.  Sounds amazing, right?!  Well, it was, but I'll get to that.  The food took a while to get to our table and when it did, it was mostly...wrong.  The three who had ordered the special were served the regular French toast instead; which was a big departure from the advertised special.  The server was very apologetic and explained that due to a glitch in the system, the regular French toast was ordered instead of the special, but that the situation would be remedied.  And each of them did finally receive the amazing banana bread French toast eventually; but not after eating pretty much all of the original French toast since the replacement order was slow to arrive.  In the meantime, another friend leaned in and, very innocently asked, "Is Eggs Benedict supposed to be cold?"  Alas friend, it is not supposed to be cold.  She sheepishly mentioned this to our server, who really was quite upset at the entire spectacle on our behalf, and he took it to the kitchen immediately.  What returned a few minutes later was Eggs Benedict.  Her previous order of Eggs Benedict, to be exact.  The same bit was taken out of the one muffin and the previously beautifully poached eggs, were now a yellow mess of luke-warm goo on top of each muffin.    The good news is, the company was stellar and we mostly laughed through the entire visit.  We also felt bad for our server and knew full-well that most of this was likely not his fault.  He mentioned that he would be speaking to the manager since the situation was "unacceptable."  The manager did stop by our table to ask how everything was going.  We mentioned that there were a few "glitches" and left it at that.  He asked if the only issues of the day were with the French toast.  We explained that another dish arrived cold and appeared to have just been reheated in the microwave, to wish he replied "we don't own a microwave." Meooow.  No one pursued the issue and all of us were given 50% off our respective bills - even those two of us (myself included) who were served their food without issue (Shrimp Clemenceu and another who ordered Fried Chicken & Waffles).  Soooo, NOLA. What do to? The food is pretty good. The service is pretty slow. And, up until the aforementioned manager paid us an odd visit, I might've given it another go.  But that was just...well...weird.

_-1oqDpHApg_bF2vN_HOjA.text: We had never been there before and we were just randomly stopping in. The drinks were delicious and the stuffed mushrooms and creole margarita flatbread were amazing! Service was quick and hospitable! I wish there were drink specials!

5ANP4XYQHHD-Vp_TjmwaQw.text: My first time here was a terrible experience. I didn't get served after sitting at a table for twenty minutes. I ended up just leaving. Recently I gave it a second go and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was helpful and attentive. The atmosphere is awesome. I had the jambalaya that I shared with a friend thanks to the waitress telling us that we would be better off sharing. That waitress changed my whole view of this place. I would definitely come back for the jambalaya.

46VYYH--3DTybbrr3t_Ckw.text: Visiting the Pittsburgh area found this place on yelp. The food was good. Fries was cold and my Gumbo was cold too. SERVICES WAS VERY BAD and it was not busy  it was on a Thursday at 3:00.
